detailsOfAchievement: Two students Rahul Kumar and Sanoj Kumar have won Dr APJ Abdul Kalam IGNITE Award for their innovative ideas. Altogether thirteen students from Bihar Government schools have been bestowed with this prestigious award.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The National Innovation FoundationFoundation’s IGNITE campaign is an annual national competition to harness the creative and innovative spirit of school children. Students are invited to send their original ideas of technological innovations to the IGNITE team headed by Professor Anil Gupta, an authority on grassroots innovation in the world. We have been taking the campaign to students in Bihar. We have reached out to 60000 children in state schools, and ten children have received the Award.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited BHEL is a Public Sector Undertaking founded by the Government of India
sourceOfFunds.purpose: DISHA implemented a project for two years w.e.f. March 2013 to February 2015 in the slum clusters of Mayapuri, Nangalraya, Naraina, Kirti Nagar and Chunna Bhatti area in New Delhi to enable 1200 underprivileged children by imparting primary level education and mainstreaming them in Government schools. DISHA also trained 240 youth to learn skills in photography, household linen, beauty culture, computer literacy and spoken English for batter employability.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited founded by the Government of India
sourceOfFunds.purpose: DISHA implemented a community development project from November 2012 to October 2014 in Kahalgaon, Bihar. The main intervention was through formation of Self-Help Groups, starting micro credit, linkage with lead banks for micro enterprises, skill training, capacity building of members and group leaders of SHGs, educational program with children for improvement of quality of education &amp; training in adolescent reproductive benefiting 1405 poor women &amp; their families.

detailsOfAchievement: DOMESTIC WORKERS SECTOR SKILL COUNCIL is a not for profit company, registered under the Companies Act, 2013 and obtained a license under section 8 of the said Act The purpose of this SSC is to define key sectors wherein Domestic Workers can find employment and to identify critical roles and ssociated skill gaps. The SSC aims to achieve the following objectives:- â€¢ To establish a national institutional network for skill development of domestic workers in India. â€¢ To facilitate linkages among various stakeholders in the sector for improved service delivery for the clients and improved reward package for the workers. â€¢ To develop a Labor Market Information System (LMIS) that contains information on the profile of domestic workers in India, the market demand and the list of organizations working in the sector. â€¢ To define job roles and set occupation standards, career progression maps and functional maps for all job roles in the domestic workersâ€™ sector. â€¢ To create skill aspiration and skill appreciation in the sector through well-defined career progression tracks and awareness campaigns for employers and workers. â€¢ To standardize processes of accreditation, assessment and certification of domestic workers through the national network of placement agencies. â€¢ To build institutional capacities and promote institutions servicing the sector to deliver skills training and recognition services for domestic workers. â€¢ To contribute to the creation of a favorable environment for domestic workers.

detailsOfAchievement: The Salesians of Don Bosco â€“ an international organization dedicated full time to the service of young people, especially those who are poorer and disadvantaged. The society is founded by St. John Bosco, an Italian saint-educator who has left posterity in his unique way of educating the homeless boys with opportunities for livelihood skills. Today the society works for the development and education of the young especially those most at risk. Through its 3000 Schools, Colleges, Technical schools and youth centers in 132 countries, the Salesians of Don Bosco serve all young people irrespective of religious differences or social inequalities. The need for skill based training for the disadvantaged youth is always felt by the Salesians. A forum was created to strengthen the vocational training program in India which was approved by the Salesian Provincial Conference of South Asia (SPCSA), the apex body of the Don Bosco in India. DB Tech was set up in 2008 with an objective to provide quality vocational training to the disadvantaged youth. DB Tech provides employment-linked, market-driven vocational courses of short duration to the economically and socially marginalized youth. A network of 125 skill training centres, DB Tech is arguably the largest spread across 25 states of India. Milestones BOSCO is a society that dreams and dares to reach out to millions of marginalized youth. Letâ€™s have a glance at the colossal growth of this NGO in a sequential order ever since its inception. 2000 â€“ Set-up Bosco Organization for Social Concern and Operation (BOSCO) 2001 â€“ BOSCO Registered as a non-profit, non-political and non-religious charitable society under the Societies Registration Act 1860. 2002 â€“ Started Children Sponsorship Program to assist school going children of socially and economically deprived sections of the community. 2003 â€“ BOSCO registered under Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FRCA). 2004 â€“ Started Social development activities for young women 2005 â€“ Launch of project with support from DMOS-COMIDE 2006 â€“ Don Bosco Tech India set up to strengthen the skill based training and placement at a national level. 2007 â€“ Partnered with NGOs across country for vocational training, staff training programmes, placements, income generation programme, health related interventions and capacity building of SHGs. 2008 â€“ Don Bosco Tech established to provide quality vocational training to youth at risk. 2009 â€“ DB Tech in partnership with Accenture launched short term skill training centres. 2010 â€“ Bosco Academy for Skills and Employment (BASE) project launched in partnership with Ministry of Rural Development (Govt. of India). 2011- Partner with Schneider Electric to implementation skill development program in India.
